text: 330ml can at home on 18 Feb 2017, from Good Spirits Company, West Nile Street, Glasgow, fruity, citrus aroma, straw with a thin lively white head, orange, grain, yeasty, viscous, fizzy, develops an increasingly herbal finish as it warms.
Can from good spirits co Glasgow a hazy golden beer with fruity herbal aroma flavour is orange wheat some herbal spicy flavour hoppy ipa wheat beer hybrid
9/20 The orange and coriander didnt really work for me. Quite a strange tasting beer.
Patricks 060716. Golden-orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is pine, malt, hop, berries. Flavour is pine, malt, hop, berries, peaches, apricot, fruit, spices. Full body. Nice beer.
Pours a hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma of orange and some spice. Taste had banana along with the orange, yeast and has a nice bitterness to it. Very enjoyable.

On tap at Hopyard, june 17th 2016. Hazy orange body with a nice staying white head. Aroma is spicy with mango, grass and peach. Taste is sweet and bitter with yeast esters, mango, mild tartness in finish. Fruity and refreshing, good creamy mouthfeel. Very nice.

Can from Rehills, Newcastle. Cloudy straw coloured with a thin white head. It has a lemon and tart fruit flavour with herbal and spicy notes followed by vanilla, more lemon and earthy notes on the finish. Pretty good.

Draught @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand
Pours slightly hazy golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, yeast, citrus and orange. Taste is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long slightly dry, yeasty, citrus and orange finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Looks - cloudy, dark yellow with a creamy thick white head.

Aroma - some banana, nutmeg, coriander, orange and tropic fruits, citrus possibly grapefruit.

Taste: The banana and orange is present. Has a surprisingly bitter citrus\grassy aftertaste which overpowers it.

Price paid: £2.59

Can 33cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Hazy golden.
T: Wheat, banana, citrus, yeast, hops.

On tap at Patricks. An almost clear one, with a small, dense off-white head. Citrusy, lightly yeasty and spiced nose with some malts. Its medium bodied and quite smooth on the palate, with a nice bitterness. Sort of boring flavor though, with yeast and spice notes, and some pale malts. Mostly on the fruity side, also in the finish. Sort of buttery and fatty. Rather weird this one. Not my kind of beer. 160716

Pours a hazy deep orange color with medium off-white head. Aroma has banana, citrus and spiciness, with white pepper and coriander standing out. Taste follows the aroma, riped banana, medium spiciness, lemon and slightly grapefruit, finishing with a moderae bitterness.

Draught at HopYard, Mathallen. Bright golden body. Diminishing white head, leaving crocheted lacing behind. Bread and banana caramel nose. Banana, wheat, caramel and lemon to the taste buds backed by Belgian yeasty fruitiness. Bittersweet finish. Fine bodied. A nice one (Oslo 16.06.2016).

Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head which soon recedes to a foamy layer.

Aroma is mango, peach and banana

Taste is banana, vanilla, peach sweet, slight grassy bitterness, coriander spice bitterness.

Pours cloudy orange with a thin head. God I love the aroma, like banana custard with a hint of oranges. Quite a lot more bitter than any wheat beer Ive had before, hoppy with hints of yeast and quite bitter.
Bottle, The Offie, Leicester. Hazy orange gold with a white head. Wheat and yeast with oranges. Spicy with hints of banana and coriander. Creamy with a dry finish. Hot alcohol. Good.

Can from the Good Spirits Co Wine & Beer.

This is a right fruity number, with a pleasantly creamy texture. Plenty of hops, a deft use of coriander, and tasty Belgian yeasty notes. Excellent

Covers a fair amount of bases. Belgian wit style that borrows a little from German weizen style. Coriander on nose that almost comes on like banana esters, but it has not quite got that farmyard funky. Nose also has waxy lemon and orange zest, and possibly pineapple hops too? Key lime pie? Any number of fruits in the taste  longish lemon-y finish.

330ml can. Murky, yellow-ish golden colour with small to average, thick, creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Peppery spicy yeasty aroma, hints of brine, white and green pepper, mustard seed, coriander, salami. Taste is slightly sweet wheaty, fruity, notes of apricot, hints of orange, mandarine, peppery spicy overtones of coriander, white and green pepper, a touch of mustard seed; bitter hints of orange zest in the finish. Full body, soft, minimally sticky palate, refreshing, average to lively carbonation. Quite beefy for a Wit.

Can from Beets, Leith. Pours slightly hazy. Pale gold. Fluffy white head with staying power. Aroma has plenty of spiced, yeast character. Over-ripe banana. A whaft of farmyard and wet straw. A nice dunt of dank from the hops. However, the hopping is more restrained than I would have personally liked. Some candy-like tropicality. Smooth as can be on first taste. Beautifully textured. Fine, creamy carbonation. Syrupy sweet oranges to start. Banana bread malting. Good, full bitterness that really spreads across the mouth. Long, juicy finish. Very nice.

Orange milkshake, other citrus fruits, caramel and bread malts, wheat, yeast. Hazy, pale gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light sweet. Caramel, bread malts, molasses, sweet orange, pine, yeast, soft carbonation, bitter, grassy finish. Very nice Witbier, excellent aroma and palate. Can from We brought Beer, Clapham Junction.

Can. Nose is banana, hints of lime, banana ice cream, cloves, orange, spice. Taste is banana, cream, lime and pinapple from the US hops with a hint of bitter, leading to a dry, cloves, corriander and spice finish. Lots of corriander and herbal in the finish as it breaths.

Clearly a beer which divides, but I loved this as a man who enjoys a good wit.

Pours hazy light golden with good white head. Aromas of belgian yeast with pepper, lemon and hint of herbs. Maybe some honey? And light malts. Taste is immensely banana-ish with moderate bitter finish. Good carbonation and body make it very drinkable. Not too much Belgian yeast on the palette which is amazing considering how much banana flavour there is.

Draft @ Tilquin English Fest 16, courtesy of and shared with the fine Belgian RB crew. 
De couleur orangée, col fin blanc-cassé.
Arôme est léger finement houblonné avec un rétro léger belge, petite note dépice de coriandre mais restant minimaliste. Lajout dhoublons US aide à rajouter une fine sensation olfactive de fruité.
Palais est plus centré sur un malt froment, pointe de fruité citronné et léger fleuri avec une couverture belge fine dester au niveau de la levure qui reste assez épaisse en fin de bouche avec un léger épicé de coriandre.
Draught  No head left, orangey beer with a very faint haze. Other grains/wheatnose, spices, coriander. Taste: coriandersoup. MF: corianderslickness. UGH!
Cloudy with a big white head... hoppy wit, with coriander, light yeast esters... slight banana... nice hoppy bite. Tasty.
Borefts Beer Festival 2015. Cloudy yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma of coriander and citrus. Sweet spicy and fruity flavour

On tap at Borefts Beer Festival day 2. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has wheat, sweet, floral esters, bread, hops, citrus. Taste is sweet, lots of wheat and esters. slight hops. Light, crisp body and an average carbonation.
Tap at Kittys, Helsinki. Colour is slightly cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Spices, wheat, Belgian yeast and malts.
Draught at Kitty's. Hazy orange color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, peach, mango, grass and earthy notes. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, mango, peach and grass. Very nice IPA.
Hazy yellow. The aroma and flavour remind me very much of a witbier. Light tartness. Its fruity, tangy and fresh.

26/IX/15 - on tap @ Borefts 2015 (Bodegraven) - BB: n/a (2015-1377) Thanks to 77ships, Elmanana+1 and the Israeli beer tickers scene for sharing todays beers!
Bit cloudy orange beer, creamy off-white head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: very fruity, exotic fruits, resinous, hoppy, citrus. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: fruity, exotic fruits, melons, bit sweet, hoppy, bitter. Aftertaste: resinous, bitter hops, citrus, pineapple.

[9/26/15] Draught sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2015 in Bodegraven. Cloudy yellow. Aroma of wheat, phenolic spiciness, and a bit of hops. Bitterish flavor, dry, with wheat, spiciness, and some hops. Light to medium-bodied.

Tap @ Borefts Beer Festival. Pours golden orange with a white head. Aroma of wheat, bread crust, some fresh hops, sweeter esters, citrus and floral notes. The taste is refreshing with all the notes from the aroma along with a rather creamy body. Like a wit with a kick of hops - comes out refreshing!
Sampled at BBF, pours hazy golden orange with average white head. Notes are coriander, orange peel, spice, and banana ester. Not a huge wit fan but this was decent.
Draft at Borefts, thanks all for sharing! Grass, weeds, light sour, wheaty. Nice, but a bit of a letdown considering this is Magic Rock.

Thx! for sharing. Sampled draft @ Borefts 2015. Day 2. Hazy orange, creamy white head. Nose is rich grass, weeds, floral hops. Taste is flowers, bit too yeasty, grass, weeds, overly grassy, weeds, yeast, light wheat. Body is overly yeasty. Doesnt entirely work but good enough.
Moderat hopfiger Antrunk. Etwas süßlich hefig, rund, die Hopfigkeit steigt noch. Würzig, etwas hefig. Gut. 11/11/11/12//11
Trübes goldgelbes Bier mit einer mittelgroßen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr fruchtig, grapefruit, Gewürze. Geschmack sehr malzig, leicht hopfig, grasig bitter, Gewürze.

Pours pale amber/orange with a large head.
Nose shows overt peppery, herbal and spicy hops along with strong orange peel notes. Some doughy wheat underneath works well as a base.
Flavours include some light malt sweetness before orange peel and herbal, spicy hops come rolling through by the truckload, leading to an assertively bitter finish.
On tap at Forestors Beer Hall Collingwood 210515. Very pale looing in the glass, looks thin and watery but it does have a bit of body to it. Quite a big hit of alcohol in the aftertaste.
Draught at Mikkeller&Friends. Clear golden - white head. Acid. Light banana. Herbal. Fat eastery. Spicy coriander. Soapy. Light malty. Wheaty notes.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ & Friends, Copenhagen - golden pour with white head. Aroma and taste is lemon citric and floral, crisp light malt, floral hoppy, light citric spice.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy golden colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel and coriander with notes of celery.
Fruity flavor of coriander with notes of spices and hops.
Hoppy finish.
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is smooth fruity. Crisp hoppy. Bitter, Crisp and citrusy. Bitter, smooth fruity and crisp hoppy finish.
On tap. Hazy orange yellow pour with white head. Aroma is citrus and yeast. Nice floral citrussy taste. Oranges and lemons. Dry finish.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2016 Sampled at SBWF 2013.Small and short off white head. Light clowdy golden color beer. Superfresh hop aroma from american /new world hops. Fruity hop taste and a small caramell taste and a medium bitterness and medium body . 
Rated 20160730
Big and lasting white head over a cloudy golden color beer. Big wheat / witt aroma. Soft wheat taste that also is fresh from lightly hopped with American hops. Light body and very refreshing.
Keg at spitfire. Cloudy yellow, white fluffy head. Spicy lemon herbal nose. Medium body. Wheat hefe taste. Coriander and citrus. Good quirky take on a classic, I just don't like the name!
Keg at Spitfire. Hazy pale. Nose is lemon, wheat. Flavour is citrus, wheat, Belgian yeast, coriander, zest.
Nice mash-up enjoyed many times. Like a Belgian sailor wrestling with a mid-Atlantic hophead busker. Many notes to play. Such good music. mmm thats right pilgrim.

Keg at Port Street Ale House, Manchester. A clear golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma of belgian yeast, lemon, coriander, apple and resin. Taste of citrusy lemon, orange, apple, belgian yeast, coriander, earthy hops and resin. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A citrusy, herbal finish. I wasnt expecting to like this but its refreshing, tasty and quite unique. A must try.
Keg @ Hanging Bat. Pale yellow orange, reasonable head. Yeasty lemon aroma. Hoppy resin flavour. Bitter aftertaste. A really good example of a beer style I dont normally like.
Keg at holyrood 9a. Pours hazy orange, nose is citrus, floral, taste is juicy fruit, dry, yeasty.
Keg at Craft Islington. Lemon juice, bitter but bit of ice cream too. Strange. Soapy. Feels a bit too boozy. Wheat appears a bit further down. Some interesting herb or something. Maybe clove.
Pours a hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of Orange with a hint of coriander. Hippy bitter taste.
Cask @ Old Gate, Hebden Bridge. Hazy amber coloured with a thin head. Has a gritty, malt-infused tropical fruit aroma and taste with sugars running through its character.
Keg. Cloudy gold ale. Thin lasting white head. Nose is lemons and solphadine. A little bit of foam banana. Taste is foam bananas soaked in gin with a little bit of basil. Tasty sipping ale.

Draft at Cask. Pours cloudy orange with a white head. Aroma of soapy and grassy hops, light pine, resinous hops and citrus. Flavour is light sweet and over moderate bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Tap at Cask, Pimlico. Poured a hazy medium amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is yeast, big lemon citrus. The flavour is moderate bitter with a yeast, zesty sherbet citrus, light spice palate. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation.

On tap at craft beer co Braxton. Golden Orange cloudy with lasting head and full lace. Grapefruit spice and tangy aroma. Melon tropical fruit with grapefruit rind bitterness dry spicy finish with coriander and orange. Medium light soft body. Spicy citrus tangy light for abv. Super fuckin excellent.
Draft. Hazy golden yellow color, medium white head. Aroma of grapefruit, orange, light spice. Taste is spiced citrus, bitter finish. Interesting.
Keg hand drawn monkey Huddersfield. Hazy orange ok head. Aroma is fruity corriander yeast taste same some banana cloves pepper good long bitter finish. Decent mouthfeel prickly carbonated. V good.
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2015 At Pivni in York, another Magic Rock classic.... Great aroma, great hops, great ipa...

Tap. Rutland Arms, Sheffield. Cloudy, dark orange. Thin, sticky, white head. Juicy, orange hop. Soft, toffee malts. Nice level of the Belgian spiciness. Taste is fruity sweet. Turns fairly bitter, with a little spicy dry edge. Feels soft, but full bodied. Finishes bitter, with a sweetness lingering on the lips. Easy drinker for the ABV. Very nice.

Keg, Liverpool Craft Beer Expo, Camp & Furnace. Hazy yellow looks with a thin white head. Tropical fruits, yeast and malts in the nose. Flavour was sweetish with notes of clove,eester, banana and cinnamon backed up by some pretty robust hoppage. A good mix of flavours and styles, interesting and enjoyable brew.
chiara velata buona schiuma persistente agrumata leggera speziatura secca note citriche buon amaro

Cloudy golden pour. Lots of lace. Very thin wispy head. Aroma is full of vinegar, slight vegetal, like fresh jalapenos. Taste is full of yeast, orange peel, and again siightly vegetal. Full mouth. This may have been infected with something.

Tap at Westow House, 15/06/14. Pours a hazy yellow hay colour with a white head. Aroma has a pleasant lemon yeasty light wheatiness. Lightish body, medium carbonation. A little lem on sherbet, orange, cherry, white bread, candy... Tasty.

On tap at Craft Beer Co Covent Gardens, pours a cloud golden with a large white head. Aroma brings out potent citrus notes, Belgian yeast, and piney hops - exquisite aromatics. Flavour is potent, with loads of Belgian yeast, citrus, and piney hops. Phenomenal balance of flavours, with a citrus, piney and yeasty finish. Excellent.

Keg at Brewdog. Pale hazy yellow, small white head. Aroma - malty, lemon, medicinal. Body is medium to light, slightly foamy. Taste is weird - dental rinse, sock juice (if there is such a thing), musty. Hmm. Its OK - there is some fruit coming through, but its not pushing my buttons.

Draft at the Pint Shop, Cambridge on 24 November 2013. Poured a cloudy orange with a tight white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, candy sugar and peaches. Spicy flavours at the fore with notes of cinnamon, honey and tropical fruits. Finish was chewy malt, esters, orange peal and mango. Fantastic witbier, probably one of the best non-Belgian/Dutch examples Ive ever tried.

Pours hazy light amber with low white head. Aroma of citrus, honey, spices, coriander, light orange peel. Taste is sweet, fruity and wheaty with light bitter finish. Body is light and smooth creamy with soft carbonation. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours light amber. Nose of citrus fruits and a hint of pepper and TCP. Citrus and wood spices on the palate, nice and dry on the tounge first off, then a wonderful smoky, oaky taste after the mouthful has finished. (Rating backlog tasted on or around 14/06/13)

On tap at The Rover. Cloudy orange with a small white head. Light aroma with citrusy notes, sweet malt, coriander and esters. Taste is sweet with spicy and citrusy notes. Medium body, soft carbonation. Finish has a spicy kick to it, low bitterness.

Tap at BD Shepherds Bush. Pours vibrant orange with a small, form white head. Nose is very fruit driven - apricot and mango with mild spice and grass. Taste has all the makings of a typical wheat but this has been hopped up superbly. Great balance retained behind the punch bowl fruits which come through. Great stuff

(Keg at Drink Baar, 20131125) The beer poured golden and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had coriander, fruitiness and Belgian style yeast. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, coriander, Belgian style yeast, grass and bitterness. Aftertaste had coriander and bitterness. A very different wit.
Une blanche anglaise. Beaucoup de fruits et de fleur au nez, toujours présents au palais. Agréable à boire mais sans en redemander.

Tap. Hazy orange color. Small size, white head, stays. Oranges, wheat, ripe banana and juice flesh in aroma. Massive alcohol, orange peel, sweet notes in flavor. So messy. Strong alcohol and candy in aftertaste. Messy messy brew.

Keg at pub rotary. 
Aroma is very much lika tropical juice. Lots of pineapple, passion fruit and mango. 
Hazy orange colour with a big head 
Sweet, a bit tart still reminding a lot of tropical juice. Low bitterness in the finish. 
Medium to full body, dry with low carbonation 
Dont have much experience of belgian wit, but its nice enough. Really fruity.
Botle. white head. Hoppy, fruity aroma, malt, wheat. Off-dry, medium body, high bitterness, High carbonation.
On tap at Biercab. Amber colour with small white head. Orange, wheat aroma, some hops. Wheat, slightly sweet taste, also fruity and spicy. Slightly hoppy. Light to medium body.
I like wheat beers but this was not balanced at all it was sour in the background

Keg at the old fountain. Not sure if this is tiquilla batrell or not. Aroma is dank musty orange hop. Flavour is wheaty malt , tangerine , dank, lime. There is is distinct saltyness in the flavour. Complex and bold.
Keg at CBC Clerkenwell.. Golden pour, fruity floral aroma, orange zest in aroma. Very flavorful, spice, fruit juice. Tons of flavor. Very nice

Keg at Red Squirrel. Pours hazy orange with a thin white head, sticks around a while. Very rich nose, sweet, bready malt, orange zest, hint of spice, more white pepper than clove though, then marmalade. The marmalade became more prevalent through drinking. Smooth for a 7% wit though. On the sweet side of things, a touch more bittering hops would have pushed it towards 9 for taste. Medium bodied, creamy texture, average carbonation for the style, good, long, marmalade finish. Nice.

Keg at Zly Casy. Pours an Orangey Yellow with a good White head. Lots of tropical new world hop character. I think a mellow Wit is a really good showcase for hops. A bit like an American Wheat Ale. The notes of Mango and pineapple are really well rendered and the foamy Wit character is subdued leading to a pleasing bitter finish. Very nice.
Hazy amber color. Lemon meringue cake,, wheat, a touch of dried strawberries in the nose. Clean wheaty with dried fruit notes. Lingering dry fruit finish, with some bready notes. Good, but not great
Tap @Kaisla. Pours cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma: Candyfloss, oranges. Some mediocre malt. Taste: Medium plus sweet, a bit rough bitterness. Palate: Medium palate. Good.

Draft @ Söder Om Småland, Malmö. Pours a hazy orange color with a small white head. Had a fruity wheat malty spicy aroma with weak buttery hints. Fruity wheat malty spicy citrus flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy weak buttery caramel finish with hoppy citrus hint.

Tap @ Kaisla, Helsinki. Pours a pale orange with a small, white head. Aroma is hoppy with grapefruit, quite a bit of citrus, some wheat, a dab of coriander. Taste is much like an IPA with grapefruit on the forefront. Some wheat, some coriander. Tad acidic and bright and spicy. Good to me, but maybe not what they were going for? Stiff with good carbonation. Gets a bit off as it warms up.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2013 Tap (Kaisla, Helsinki) (7:4:6:3:13=3.4)
Amazing over-the-top fruit coctail aroma, quite spicy. Smooth palate, a little slick. A touch dull in the palate, mashy light grains, a bit stodgy. Hops are a little acidic, very full hops. Not exciting me, does cover the alcohol well, possibly smothering it with stickiness? The previous brown ale pressed my buttons more. Not exactly messy, but not a particularly coherent beer. I keep asking myself "did they actually want it to taste this way?"
Rerate (Drink Baar, Tallinn) (6:3:5:2:11=2.7)
weizenbock strong wheatines, curacao?. Punch in the face from the alcohol. Booze in the finish too. Dry and bitter. Slick sweetness. Messed up. This beer wasnt loved by its parents, and just wants a fight.
Rerate of the above (5:4:6:3:11=2.9)
Aggressive harsh sharp aroma. Mellower in the mouth. Still not good.
Tap at Holyrood 9A. Spicy and citrus aroma. Floavour is very spicy with some balance provided by the orage and hops. Yeast quite apparent. Not really my favourite style but an interesting beer.

Draught @ Malja, Kuopio. Pours a cloudy orange colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of wheat, grains and pineapple. Flavour of caramel, wheat, bitter grassy hops, bubblegum, pineapple, floral notes, yeast and biscuit. Medium bodied, low carbonation and a juicy, floral, sweet finish. Good, although a bit musty.

Keg at The Vintage, Edinburgh, Scotland. Pale golden body, little to no head, sweet malty aroma, light citrusy taste with a small hop on the tongue. Feels more like a combination of a Belgian Wit and Pale - lovely!

Draught at the Malja, Kuopio, Finland.
Looks rather dark for a Witbier. Murky brown colour with a tiny off-white head. Absolutely delicious aroma full of fruity hoppiness, juicy sweetness, mild yeast and some smooth malty wheatiness. The flavour is quite strongly alcoholic. There's sweet fruity hops, mild bitterness, malt, wheat and some sugary sweetness. The flavour is too sweet to be enjoyable. Mild hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Gallows Bird, Espoo

Pours murky dark orange with a smooth white head. Aroma of stingy floral hops, orange peel, citrus, wheat and spices. Taste is a bit musty with notes of wheaty sourness, stingy floral hops, orange peel, spices and yeast. Finish is hoppy, fruity, yeasty and spicy. A bit unbalanced, feels a bit off.

On tap at the Furnace Inn

Just before moving on I settled on this release. Not quite sure what to expect except a big body I was surprised to find a very drinkable wit. While it definitely does not fall into the "sessionable" category I could happily drink a pint or two and call it a night.

Aroma / Appearance - The carbonated wispy head protects a dense cloudy body. Like a glass full of orange pulp it is thick and creamy. Wheat, rye, sugar, and cotton candy are a mixture of festival and farm. The white pepper bite only adds another layer of complexity.

Flavor / Palate - White pepper, grapefruit, and chewy jam thicken like sap as they move from tongue to throat. The mouthfeel is a bit like drinking watered down marmalade. The tangerine finish brings in this great tropical aspect that almost had me going back to another. Im sure this will not be my last Magic Rock draft.

(Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, 28 May 2013) Cloudy brownish yellow colour with brief, white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with citrus, peaches, white bread, a slightly soapy wheat character and hints of clove and coriander. Malty, fruity taste with notes of citrus, banana, bready malt, coriander, lemon peel and a certain citric bitterness taking over in the finish. More than medium body, with a certain sweetness. Interesting and unconventional take on the style. Nice one.

Flaska till Tulip. Enormt ljus, svårt att definiera typ. Lite Pale Ale, lite pilsner men även en del jäst a la Leffe. Helt Ok

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drunk with Dom and Dan. Sweet and sour? Dunno. Cant remember. Hides its abv fairly well. But not what I hoped for.
On tap at Stirchley Wines! Hows about that then urghy urghy urgh. Thick, sweet, smooth. Almost a lactic sourness to the wheat - feels quite big.

The other day I felt like the bear from I want my hat back. High wire, cannonball, clown juice? Eh up, I said to the wife, theyre all to do with circus. I may have said it in a Yorkshire accent, I may not, but you get the drift. Im really not very good at this, as shall become apparent. Nobody will ever call me a purist. This was lovely.

On tap at Bishops Folkis, February 2013.

An interesting hybrid this one. Hazy golden/orange with a medium white head. Aroma and taste of orange, citrus, wheat and some light spices. Also some yeast. Descent.

@bishops: en lite märklig blandning av veteöl och IPA. Trevlig men inte riktigt min grej. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy orange in colour, muted aroma perhaps as it was cold from the keg. Silky smooth, spicy, bananas, hoppy leaving a warm spicy finish. Nice stuff.

on tap at slunce ve skle 2012, first beer of the day. hazy golden with plenty of lacing; well-balanced aroma of orange peel and tropical fruit; some touches of wheaty acidity with some earthy pine and a medicinal dry finish. a good attempt at a bold idea, though not quite up there with viva la wita

Draught @ Euston Tap, 190 Euston Road, London, Greater London, England NW1 2EF.Unclear medium orange - yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, pale malt, wheat, moderate to light heavy hoppy - yeast, citrus, fruity - tropical fruit, initial some medicine notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, frity - tropical fruit, citrus. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120803]

Aroma: Muted aroma of yeast and white pepper.

Appearance: Clear amber body with a medium white head that slowly fades. No visible carbonation. Slight lacing. 

Taste: Malt and coriander with a strange tomato note. Lightly spicy. Alcohol content is quite noticeable. 

Palate: Medium body with an oily texture. Flat carbonation. 

Overall: Complex and unusual. Im not quite sure how to define this beer, but the more I drank, the more I seemed to enjoy it.
On tap ay Zubaty pes. Pours clear golden to amber with nice white head. Aroma is hops, orange and some sweet fruits. Flavor is hops, citrus fruits, banana. Is this really a witbier?

On tap at Craft Beer Co. While I was generally impressed with the Magic Rock offerings I tried, not much can overcome my general indifference to wits. Certainly a fresh, vibrant golden pour, well-bedecked with foam. Strongly yeasty nose, nothing cloying and indeed a hint or two of saison. But the taste was just a bit average, losing the modest complexity the nose hinted at. Okay.

Kegerator fill at great grog. Pours amber with white head that fades to a ring. Hoppy aroma, grapefruit, mango also low levels of Belgian spicy phenols and something slightly solvent like, possibly the corriander. Taste has grapefruit, mango and alcohol then a herbal finish. Medium bodied with a bitter finish. Cant decide if I like this

Draught at Ölrepubliken, Götebrog, Sweden. Hazy golden, meidum white head. Strong orange aroma which pretty much dominates everything else, some vague spicy notes. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness. A bit one dimensional.
Keg at Brewdog Shoreditch, 7th November 2012. Not my favourite style, this seemed fairly pleasant, probably my least favourite of the magic rock range, they are an excellent brewery generally
On tap Euston Tap.  clear gold thick white head. Certainly hoppy. Certainly a bit belgiany. Bit bizarre. Not sure it completely works. Some soap. Ok

Draught (Oliver Twist, Stockholm) - Amber with a small head. Gooseberry, grapefruit, passion fruit and pineapple in the aroma. Hoppy, tangy and slightly sweet taste with notes of lemon, grapefruit, pineapple and lychee. Incredibly refreshing and easy to drink.

Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm.  Hazy bronze colour, small head. Rich lychee and mango aroma. Sweetish with medium body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Lots of tropical fruits, sloght coriander. Mid bitter finish. Essentially an APA with the slightest twist.

On tap @ Cardinal. Slightly hazy orange body with a small off-white head. Nice aroma of citric fruit, peaches and apricot with fruity yeast and spices. A nice and refreshing flavor, a bit on the sweeter side, but almost enough bitterness to balance the sweetness. A fine body with a nice bitter and fruity aftertaste, a hint of oranges is also appearing here. Easy to drink, smooth and refreshing.

Incredibly smooth for a cask beer. Almost creamy. In fact it reminds me of the Marble 'lemon cheesecake' style. But much lighter and more refreshing. With the unmistakable banana hints of Belgian yeast. Dangerously drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Cardinal.
Golden color, good foam.
Distinct hoppy aromas ( pine), some fruitiness and citrus notes 
Medium body & medium high complexity . Solid bitterness
Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger, Golden colour, moderate white head. Lovely aroma of citrus and tropical fruits, some spicy notes too. The well balanced flavour has notes of citrussy and resinous hops throughout, but is not too bitter. Also spicy notes (coriander). An excellent fusion between witbier and IPA, dangerously drinkable.

Keg	North Bar	Leeds	08/10/12.  Only slightly hazy orangey copper coloured beer with a whitish head and lacing.  Very hoppy throughout this.  Total New World hopping.  Slight witty spicing but it really is all about the hops.  A very nice malt balance with just a touch of sweetness.  A really accomplished beer with a very long finish.  this may have the Belgian yeast and spicing but its in no way a Witbier.  More a wheat IPA.

Cask @ OT. Pours clear amber with a solid frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some thick lacing on the glass. Smell is subtle and tiny sweet with crackers, lemon zest, grass and hints of grapefruit juice, cloves and butterscotch. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty with banana bread, lemon peal, dry wood, white bread, green grapes, cookies, cloves and hints of pine. Mouthfeel is round, slightly smooth, slightly flat and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with bread, lemon peal, cookies, orange zest and grass.

Draught at OT
Hazy amber with a large, rocky head. 
Very light spicy aroma. 
Warming alcohol. Pretty sweet. Medium, dry bitterness. 
Some spiciness.; clove and coriander.

On tap at the Slunce ve skle fest 2012.Pours Hazy yellowish golden with a small white head.Aroma of grassy hops,sweet malt and sour-tart grapefruit juice.Notes of Floral,citrus,grapefruit peel,spice,bitter black tea and lemon juice..

not up to the usual standards for me.  still better than most out there though.
a nod to the wit influence with a yeasty zingy taste. loads of tropical hops kind of muddle the style but create a good drink.

keg. swan on the stray. harrogate

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 On keg tap at Craft Beer Co, London on 9th September 2012. Almost clear amber with thin white head and artful lacing (Matisse curves!) Citric, fruity and yeasty aromas. Crisp and tangy in-mouth, with berries and grapefruits. Bitterness develops in a spicy finish, on a zingy mouthfeel. Values: 7/4/7/4/16. Re-rating: Keg at Craft Beer Co, Covent Garden on 11th January 2015. Opaque amber with white lacing foam. Fresh citrus aroma with lemon and tart orange. Grapefruit and bitter lemon citrus in-mouth. Bitter, citric finish. Engaging texture and fair body.

On tap @ Craft Beer Co., London. This is a near clear/soft blurry golden one with a small quickly sidestickong just off-white head. It smells quite anonymous actually. Could be the temperature perhaps. Also, unfortunately the bar is heaving some issues with a dishwasher, or the pluming or something, so the whole place is stinking of chloride right about now! Bah.. No-nice.. Well, it gives me a chance to temperate it a bit. Yeah, that helped. I get some light fruity notes here, but that chlorine really sticks around. On the taste this was really something. Its all the way golden and bitter, I get some caramel tones here. I guess it reminds me of a really really good (and strong) bitter? Light yeasty with a bit of banana sweetness, some wet leafs and a little bit of alcohol. Good. I liked this one as well, but its no wit in my opinion. 19.07.2012

Cask at CP&K, Pimlico. It pours hazy straw yellow, with a medium white head. The nose is hay, straw, pine, resin, juicy orange, tangerine and light spice. The taste is pine, resin, juicy tropical fruit, orange, tangerine, mango, passion fruit, white grape, hay and underlying spice, with a bitter, citric finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Smooth and straight-up delicious!

Yellowish golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, nectar, some tropical fruit juice as well. Flavour is caramel, fruits, alcohol, some slight nectary and spicy notes as well. Very nicely balanced and very refreshing.

Keg in Cask Pub & Kitchen. Colour is very touch hazy, amber, big white bubbly head. Nose is lots of lemon citrous, tropical fruit, grapefruit. Taste is wheat malt, caramel, lemon, tropical fruit, grapefruit. Has characteristics of a double IPA and a whit bier.

Keg at Madness. Golden yellow. I can certainly taste the spices, if not smell them. The Curucao Orange is discernible as well. Quite an odd beer, this one. It is quite, quite good, however. I had to allow myself another pint.

Tap at the Euston Tap - 01/08/12.
Hazy golden colour with a thin white head.
Grassy herbal hop notes on the nose.
Yeast in the taste a touch of wheat, citrus, mild spice and sweetish malt.
Bitter-dry finish.
Drinkable but not the best Magic Rock offering IMHO!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: One of my favorite beers. Light, refreshing belgian wit style meets an American ale/IPA. Powerful citrus nose and taste with a nice hop finish.

Tap in the Euston Tap. Pale golden colour. Aroma a combination of hop and spicy yeast. Interesting beer this; I got the Belgian angle from the spicy feel, didnt necessarily get the witbier character, felt like more of a hoppy Belgian golden ale. But who cares about the style, it is nice, interesting and very well brewed, perhaps a bit too much alcohol feel. Hopping present but quite restrained.
Draft. Yellow, white head. Big citrus fruits, banana, Belgian yeast, spices. Nice bitter pulpy finish.Great mouthfeel.

Keg at Euston Tap, London. A slightly hazy straw coloured beer with a small white head on top. Hoppy, fruity aroma. Tastes really fruity, lemon, orange some tropical fruit, spice and rich. Not like a true witbier to me, more like a rich fruity golden ale. Really drinkable and quite boozy for the style. A little more complexity and this could really be something special. Nice beer though from Magic Rock.
Draft at craft beer co, LOndon. Golden pour, fruity floral aroma, orange zest in aroma. Very flavorful, spice, fruit juice. Tons of flavor. Very nice

[keg at the Southern Bar, Edinburgh] Hazy lemon yellow pour, very thin white head. Not had an India Wit Ale before  although Ive had a few hoppy Belgian numbers in general. Very fruity  lots of lemon and lime, really easy to drink as well  does not taste as strong as it is. Supremely drinkable. Finish is long and dry, somewhat chalky [14072012]

Draught.
Pours a medium straw, with a white head.
Hoppy, fruity aroma, passion fruit, apricot, spruce, malt, wheat.
Off-dry, medium body, high bitterness, balanced CO2.
Fruity, hoppy taste, grapefruit peel, spruce, apricot, malt, passion fruit, lime, wheat, nettles, grass. (2012-07-20)

Off keg at Brewdog Manchester. A sweet ipa with a 
Leasing hop bitterness. Very enjoyable.

16th July 2012Keg at the Craft. Light haze on the pale gold beer. Short white head. Palate is very crisp, light and semi dry. Sharp minerals. Sweetish malt, light and creamy and a little floral. Whisper of banana ester. Citrus in the background - orange and lemon. Sharp carbonated finish. Very interesting -  could just do with a little more ester to fill in the middle.

Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm. Somewhat hazy golden beer with à very small head. Fruity citrus aroma, grapefruit, apples, grapes, hops. Floral flavor, yeast, citrus, grapes, hops, grass. Refreshing and well balanced.
Keg at southern bar, Edinburgh. Hazy pale yellow, orange and corriander nose. Lots of orangey hop flavour alongside classic wit notes. Strength well hidden. Slight sherbert in finish.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2012 Keg @ CPK. Excited to finally try this revered beast! Pours a deep hazy golden color with no head. The nose is pissy, funky grass, plenty of candi sugar sweetness, strong bubblegum and countryside rainwater. The taste is moderately hoppy and dry, with a sweet candi punch, light fruitiness from the wheat. Vaguely herbal in nature, some orachard fruits. The bodys medium. The alcohols a bit full on to be honest, holding the score back a bit. Overall, I love Magic Rock and their creativity. This feels a bit like a first draft.

On draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm Sweden. Alright beer. Too strong in alcohol for its own good though. Like the witte tones and the crossover in styles. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft, very fresh and prefect for summer. Wheat notes very well integrated with the hops and bitterness

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at the Euston Tap, London. Pours crystal clear, rich gold with a small, white foam head. Has an intriguing nose with some charming, pissy nelson and toasty grass. Flavor is medium to big sweet, plenty of toasted sugars, a bit of Belgian candi, sweet grass and sticky pine, some bready malts. Medium to full in body with average carbonation. Lightly warm on the finish with loads of bready malts, strong semi-dark sugars, light resinous grass and pine, very mild spices, some restrained grapefruit. Its a well-hopped Belgian-style ale. Very enjoyable.

On keg at the BrewDog Bar. Pours a yellow colour with a fair white head. Aroma of pineapple, passion fruit, caramel and alcohol. Similar flavours with mild carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel. Nicely dry.

Keg @ BrewDog, Edinburgh 290612
Vibrant light gold, clear, thin white head
Aroma  - sweet caramel, soft wheat, slight bitter herbal note, touch of resinous hops, touch of alcohol
Taste - soft wheat, floral yeast esters, soft sweet citrus, hint of orange, sweet light honey malts. bit belgian, booze well hidden, light resinous hops. Subtle with nothing too up front, weirdly refreshing for 8%
Palate - medium carb and body, oily, very smooth. Finish - soft smooth sweetish malts, soft wheat, bitter citrus, hint of warming booze.
Overall - A really good and different addition to their range

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2012 golden ... thin white head ... zezty lemon peel light floral nose ... juicy fruits ... quite oily ... rich deep bitter tones ... some citrus some passion fruit ... little grapefruit

CASK ... at hanging bat ... hazy amber ... thin white head ... soft floral orange ... nice soft floral orange zezty hop ... quite sweet ... light ooily hop ... light passion ... you know despite being cask this one still not hitting spot ... stick at 3.6

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2012 Keg at BrewDog. Vivid yellow/amber, thick white head. Slightly sweaty wheat, big cloves, light tropical fruit nose. Surprisingly sweet, banana, wheat maltiness, sort of cane sugar up front, matched by a big juicy bitterness. Citrus, passion fruit, juicy and light but with a rich malty body. Big but rounded lemony bitter finish. Nice.
